Program Iwan Bule di PSSI: Pokja Inpres Jokowi Sampai Divisi Suporter
04 Nov 2019, 03:21 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta- Ketua Umum PSSI 2019-2023, Mochamad Iriawan, akan membentuk tim kelompok kerja untuk menjalankan Instruksi Presiden Nomor 3 Tahun 2019 tentang Percepatan Persepakbolaan Nasional. "Kami akan membentuk tim pokja berkaitan dengan Inpres itu minggu depan," ujar pria yang akrab disapa Iwan Bule itu seusai kongres luar biasa (KLB) PSSI di Hotel Shangri-La, Jakarta, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Menurut Iwan Bule, yang terpilih sebagai ketua umum PSSI 2019-2023 dalam KLB, pokja tersebut akan berkoordinasi dengan kementerian dan lembaga yang tercantum dalam Inpres yang ditandatangani Presiden Joko Widodo pada 25 Januari 2019.
Pria berusia 57 tahun tersebut ingin Inpres tersebut segera terwujud dalam tindakan nyata demi mendongkrak prestasi sepak bola nasional. "PSSI harus menjemput bola. Inpres itu sejak dikeluarkan sampai sekarang belum berjalan. Jadi harus asa percepatan," tutur Iwan.
Terkait Inpres tersebut, mantan Kapolda Metro Jaya ini berterima kasih kepada Presiden Joko Widodo yang memberikan perhatian khusus kepada sepak bola. Memang, dari semua cabang olahraga yang ada di Indonesia, hanya sepak bola yang memiliki Inpres.
"Baru di zaman Pak Joko Widodo, pemerintah mengeluarkan Inpres khusus untuk sepak bola. Instruksi itu melibatkan banyak kementerian dan lembaga yang melakukan peran masing-masing untuk meningkatkan kualitas sepak bola Indonesia," kata Iwan.
Sebelumnya, Menteri Pemuda dan Olahraga Zainudin Amali sudah meminta kepada pengurus baru PSSI hasil pemilihan dalam KLB PSSI, Sabtu (2 November), untuk segera membuat peta jalan sepak bola Indonesia. "Setelah kongres selesai, kami berharap PSSI bersama KONI, KOI dan Kemenpora duduk bersama untuk menjawab perintah Inpres tersebut," ujar Zainudin.
Selain membentuk Pokja Inpres Percepatan Sepak Bola Nasional. mantan Kapolda Jawa Barat ini mengatakan pekerjaan utamanya sebagai nakhoda baru federasi sepak bola Indonesia yakni mengurus masalah suporter. Menurut dia, menyelesaikan kerusuhan suporter yang rutin terjadi menjadi salah satu langkah awal yang dilakukan kepengurusannya.
"Termasuk PR cukup berat, saya nanti akan membuat divisi khusus, divisi yang membidangi pembinaan fans atau suporter," kata dia.
Ide soal membuat divisi khusus soal suporter sudah digaungkan Iwan Bule sebagai salah satu programnya sebagai calon ketua. Pada 21 Agustus 2019, misalnya, Ia mengatakan mulai membayangkan para suporter itu dipertemukan. "Bagaimana caranya, nanti Arema, salah satu orang. Saya dapat masukan dari mana, dari mereka. Saya tanya maunya suporter apa sih, ya kan kita tidak pernah dikumpulkan," ujarnya di Jakarta kala itu.
Secara teknis, Iwan Bule memberikan gambaran, sekitar 20 orang perwakilan suporter, seperti Aremania, Jakmania, Viking, Bonek, dan komunitas suporter lainnya rutin bertemu. Kegiatannya bisa dengan berkemah bersama membahas persoalan sepak bola. "Kita kumpul berkemah. Tanggung jawab itu di kepala divisinya. Ada kepala divisi yang membidangi itu," tuturnya.
Ia mengaku gagasan soal pembinaan suporter berasal dari masukan para pendukung klub-klub. Ketika berdialog, kata dia, suporter menyampaikan saran untuk difasilitasi bertemu dengan pendukung di tim rival. "Itu baru satu pola yang saya temukan, mudah-mudahan itu bisa tercipta," katanya.
Iwan Bule memberikan contoh saat Peru melawan Brasil, suporter Brasil tidak terpancing emosi saat suporter Peru bersorak merayakan kegembiraan seusai mencetak gol. "Indonesia ingin seperti itu tentu tidak semudah membalikkan telapak tangan," ujarnya.
Mengenai jadwal kompetisi yang amburadul sehingga membuat hak siar dan sponsor enggan mengembangkan Liga Indonesia, Iwan Bule menyiapkan solusi atas problem tersebut. Menurut dia, kunci dari masalah ini adalah koordinasi dengan kepolisian dan itu harus dilakukan sampai ke tingkat Asosiasi Provinsi (Asprov). "Saya akan melakukan pertemuan dengan Mabes Polri. Dalam lingkar Asprov, bisa koordinasi dengan Polda. Saya sampaikan ke polisi bahwa kami punya kalender Timnas," kata Iwan.
Iwan Bule pun menegaskan bahwa dirinya akan terus bertahan di PSSI sampai masa jabatannya habis pada 2023 mendatang dan tidak akan tergiur jabatan politis. "Saya berkomitmen kepada PSSI. Saya akan berikan yang terbaik untuk negara dalam bidang sepak bola," ucapnya.
Dalam menjalankan roda kepengurusan PSSI empat tahun ke depan, Iwan Bule didampingi oleh dua wakil ketua umum, yakni Cucu Sumantri dan Iwan Budianto. Selain itu bakal ada 12 anggota komite ekskutif yang bakal ikut membantu. Mereka adalah Yoyok Sukawi, Dirk Soplanit, Endri Erawan, Haruna Soemitro, Hasnuryadi Sulaiman, Juni Rahman, Pieter Tanuri, Sonhadji, Ahmad Riyadh, Hasani Abdul Gani, Yunus Nusi, Vivin Cahyani.

Iwan Bule Program at PSSI: Pokja Inpres Jokowi Until Supporters Division
Nov 04 2019, 03:21 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta- General Chairperson of PSSI 2019-2023, Mochamad Iriawan, will form a working group team to carry out Presidential Instruction Number 3 of 2019 on the Acceleration of National Football. "We will form a working group with regard to the Inpres next week," said the man who is familiarly called Iwan Bule after the extraordinary PSSI congress (KLB) at the Shangri-La Hotel, Jakarta, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
According to Iwan Bule, who was elected as chairman of PSSI 2019-2023 in the KLB, the working group will coordinate with ministries and institutions listed in the Presidential Instruction signed by President Joko Widodo on January 25, 2019.
The 57-year-old man wants the Inpres to be immediately manifested in concrete actions to boost national football achievements. "PSSI has to pick up the ball. Since the Presidential Instruction was issued until now it has not yet run. So we have to expect an acceleration," said Iwan.
Related to the Presidential Instruction, the former Metro Jaya Police Chief thanked President Joko Widodo for paying special attention to football. Indeed, of all sports in Indonesia, only football has Inpres.
"Only in the era of Pak Joko Widodo, the government issued a special Presidential Instruction for football. The instruction involved many ministries and institutions that carried out their respective roles to improve the quality of Indonesian football," Iwan said.
Previously, the Minister of Youth and Sports Zainudin Amali had asked the new management of PSSI the results of the election in the PSSI KLB, Saturday (November 2), to immediately make a map of Indonesia's soccer road. "After the congress is over, we hope that PSSI together with KONI, KOI and Kemenpora sit together to answer the instructions of the Inpres," said Zainudin.
In addition to forming the National Soccer Acceleration Inpres Working Group. This former West Java Regional Police Chief said that his main job as the new skipper was the Indonesian soccer federation which was taking care of the supporter problem. According to him, resolving the routine supporter riots was one of the first steps taken by the management.
"Including the PR is quite heavy, I will later create a special division, a division in charge of fostering fans or supporters," he said.
The idea of creating a special division about supporters has been echoed by Iwan Bule as one of his programs as a candidate for chairman. On August 21, 2019, for example, he said he began to imagine that the supporters would be brought together. "How, later Arema, one of the people. I can get input from where, from them. I asked what supporters what they want, yes we were never collected," he said in Jakarta at the time.
Technically, Iwan Bule gives an illustration, about 20 representatives of supporters, such as Aremania, Jakmania, Viking, Bonek, and other supporter communities routinely meet. The activity can be done by camping together to discuss football issues. "We gathered together for camping. The responsibility was in the head of his division. There was a division head in charge of it," he said.
He claimed the idea of supporting supporters came from the input of supporters of clubs. When dialoguing, he said, supporters gave suggestions to be facilitated to meet with supporters in the rival team. "That's just one pattern that I discovered, hopefully it can be created," he said.
Iwan Bule gave an example when Peru against Brazil, Brazilian supporters were not provoked when Peruvian supporters cheered to celebrate the excitement after scoring. "Indonesia wants to be like that, certainly not as easy as turning the palm of the hand," he said.
Regarding the chaotic competition schedule that made broadcasting rights and sponsors reluctant to develop the Indonesian League, Iwan Bule prepared a solution to the problem. According to him, the key to this problem is coordination with the police and it must be done up to the level of the Provincial Association (Asprov). "I will have a meeting with the National Police Headquarters. In Asprov circles, I can coordinate with the Regional Police. I told the police that we have a national team calendar," said Iwan.
Iwan Bule also stressed that he would continue to stay at PSSI until his term expires in 2023 and would not be tempted by political office. "I am committed to PSSI. I will give the best for the country in the field of football," he said.
In running the management of PSSI for the next four years, Iwan Bule was accompanied by two deputy chairmen, namely Cucu Sumantri and Iwan Budianto. In addition there will be 12 executive committee members who will help. They are Yoyok Sukawi, Dirk Soplanit, Endri Erawan, Haruna Soemitro, Hasnuryadi Sulaiman, Juni Rahman, Pieter Tanuri, Sonhadji, Ahmad Riyadh, Hasani Abdul Gani, Yunus Nusi, Vivin Cahyani.
